intro: Hieracium chlorelliceps, commonly known as the green-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces seeds in small, fluffy clusters. Its botanical features make it a common weed in gardens and along roadsides.
